elements.title: Segment performance

data.value: Most of the planned reduction of 10,000 full-time positions has been completed, with almost 9,000 positions reduced by the end of 2022.
The majority of the job cuts occurred in Germany, with further reductions expected through the optimization or closure of foreign locations.
Reduction of the domestic branch network from 1,000 branches to 450 by mid-2022, ahead of schedule.
Operating expenses, including compulsory contributions, decreased by 3.2% in 2022 and the cost base was reduced by almost 10% when excluding variable pay effects.
Despite challenging economic conditions and high capital expenditure, operating profit reached approximately €2.1bn, exceeding initial forecasts.
These workforce reductions were part of a broader restructuring strategy in response to an adverse economic environment characterized by an energy crisis, high inflation, and geopolitical tensions.

Describes the CIP where entitlement periods start from the last full calendar month preceding the retention period. elements.title: Accounting and Measurement Policies – Hedge Accounting Change

data.value: As at 1 July 2022, Commerzbank Group changed the hedge accounting prospectively according to IFRS 9, replacing the IAS 39 option used until 30 June 2022 (see Note 42).
Apart from the hedge accounting change, the same accounting and measurement policies as at 31 December 2021 have been applied.
Financial assets and liabilities are generally measured at amortised cost unless a different form is required by IFRS standards. Income and expenses are recognized on an accrual basis.

Interest from contractual agreements is reported in net interest income on an accrual basis with negative interest presented separately. Dividend income is recognized only when a legal entitlement exists.
Commission income is recognized over the period the service is performed or at the time of service completion, with performance-related fees recognized when criteria are met.
Borrowing costs directly attributable to the acquisition, construction or production of a significant asset are capitalized if a period of at least 12 months is needed to prepare the asset for use.

Assets and liabilities are generally posted at gross amounts, though netting is applied under IAS 32.42 when legally enforceable. Currency translation is performed using appropriate spot, average, or hedging rates.
